question: What is OHRQoL?
ideal_answer: The assessment of the oral health-related quality of life (OHRQoL) is possible with the Oral Health Impact Profile-14 (OHIP-14) questionnaire comprising 7 subdomains: functional limitation, physical pain, psychological discomfort, physical disability, psychological disability, social disability, and handicap

The assessment of the oral health-related quality of life (OHRQoL) is possible with the Oral Health Impact Profile-14 (OHIP-14) questionnaire comprising 7 subdomains: functional limitation, physical pain, psychological discomfort, physical disability, psychological disability, social disability, and handicap
The OHRQoL is a concept that surpasses an exclusively clinical perception and includes functional, social, emotional, and environmental issues.
Oral health-related quality of life (OHRQoL) is a multidimensional construct that involves subjective evaluation of an individual's oral health.
BACKGROUND: Oral health-related quality of life (OHRQoL) is a multidimensional, perception-based measure of how oral health affects social and physical functioning and self-image.
STATEMENT OF PROBLEM: Oral health-related quality of life (OHRQoL) is a subjective measure that assesses a person's perception of oral health.
BACKGROUND: There is a lack of cohort studies on the influence factors of oral health-related quality of life (OHRQoL).
